Articles.Content:
Hi

I was wondering if in ksp when a tourist has multiple locations in their itinerary do they need to be accomplished in one flight or can they be flown multiple times?

For instance is a tourist wanted to fly by the mun and land on minimus would those have to be done on the same space flight or could they be launched multiple times from Kerbin?

Thanks

Tanner

Hello, and welcome to the forums!

49 minutes ago, tanner331 said:

I was wondering if in ksp when a tourist has multiple locations in their itinerary do they need to be accomplished in one flight or can they be flown multiple times?

For instance is a tourist wanted to fly by the mun and land on minimus would those have to be done on the same space flight or could they be launched multiple times from Kerbin?

Can be multiple times.  The game doesn't care about whether you do it in one flight or not.  When you have a particular tourist on board, and you satisfy one of their destinations (e.g. "orbit the Mun" or whatever), then that item gets "checked off" their list, and stays that way even if you then return them to KSC, so they'll remember that the next time you launch them onwards to their next destination.

I've done it multiple times.

They want to land on both Mun and Minmus?  That's an awful lot of delta-v for one launch, I generally do it as two.
Mun flyby and Minmus landing's no problem though it takes a while ... Mun orbit and Minmus landing's not too bad ... I never do Mun landing and anything else.
